subject: [Radiance-general] RAdiance Compile on Redhat Linux 7.1
body:
Message-ID: <00ad01c139fd$3d19e1a0$217c389c@rgraham> This is a multi-part message in MIME format. ------=_NextPart_000_00AA_01C139D3.5315B9E0 Content-Type: text/plain; charset="iso-8859-1" Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable I'm trying to compile the 3R1P8 version form the Radsite wep page. I'll = try and get to those Linux binaries. Thanks for the advice. -Robert ----- Original Message -----=20 To: 'radiance-general@radiance-online.org'=20 Sent: Monday, September 10, 2001 8:29 AM There are Linux binaries available at the distribution site: = http://radsite.lbl.gov/radiance/pub/, though I can't currently reach the = site. I didn't have any problems with the compile on Redhat, so I would = be curious to know what version you are trying to compile and what the = errors are. --thomas -----Original Message----- Sent: Monday, September 10, 2001 3:22 PM To: RADIANCE ONLINE MAILING LIST I'm trying to install Radiance on my machine running Redhat 7.1, and = I'm not having any success with it. HAs anyone heard of changes made to = the system that might cause compiler errors? It seems to fail with = about half of the executable files I expect it to make. I've made the = appropriate changes in the makeall file to point to the X11 directories, = so I'm fairly confident thats not the problem. Does anyone have and = suggestions, or perhaps know where I might find a pre-compiled version = for Linux OS? Thanks, Robert Graham ------=_NextPart_000_00AA_01C139D3.5315B9E0 Content-Type: text/html; charset="iso-8859-1" Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable
I'm trying to compile the 3R1P8 version = form the=20 Radsite wep page.  I'll try and get to those Linux binaries.  = Thanks=20 for the advice.
 
-Robert
----- Original Message -----
From:=20 Thomas Marsh
To: 'radiance-general@= radiance-online.org'=20
Sent: Monday, September 10, = 2001 8:29=20 AM
Subject: RE: [Radiance-general] = RAdiance=20 Compile on Redhat Linux 7.1

There are Linux binaries available at the distribution site: = http://radsite.lbl.gov/radi= ance/pub/,=20 though I can't currently reach the site. I didn't have any problems = with the=20 compile on Redhat, so I would be curious to know what version you are = trying=20 to compile and what the errors are.
 
--thomas
-----Original Message-----
From: Robert Graham=20 [mailto:rgraham@indiana.edu]
Sent: Monday, September 10, = 2001 3:22=20 PM
To: RADIANCE ONLINE MAILING LIST
Subject:=20 [Radiance-general] RAdiance Compile on Redhat Linux = 7.1

I'm trying to install Radiance on = my machine=20 running Redhat 7.1, and I'm not having any success with it.  = HAs anyone=20 heard of changes made to the system that might cause compiler = errors? =20 It seems to fail with about half of the executable files I expect it = to=20 make.  I've made the appropriate changes in the makeall file to = point=20 to the X11 directories, so I'm fairly confident thats not the=20 problem.   Does anyone have and suggestions, or perhaps = know where=20 I might find a pre-compiled version for Linux OS?
 
Thanks,
 
Robert=20 Graham
------=_NextPart_000_00AA_01C139D3.5315B9E0--
